title: 1840's Americana
content:
I am looking to make a list of typefaces that would've been in vogue (or that represent the 'in vogue' style) in the USA in the 1840's - 1860's or so.

Any thoughts?

Thanks!
author: evanmacdonald

comments.content:
Issued earlier but still very much in use in 1850:  
 [Bulmer](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013161831/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/bulmer_monotype_std_vp/)  
 [Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013161831/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_founders_caslon_std_virtual/)  
 [Walbaum](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013161831/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/monotype_walbaum_pro_vp/)  
 [Baskerville](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013161831/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/monotype_baskerville_pro_virtual/)  
 [Bell](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013161831/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/bell_std_vp/)

Know anyone with a specimen book from Bruce's Type Foundry? That'd be your holy grail.

Also good would be the Doug Clouse book on Mackellar, Smiths & Jordan pictured below.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013161831im_/http:/typophile.com/files/096669_3585.jpg)
